name: RentlySmartHome
0:
”Alexa, what is the thermostat set to?”
”Alexa, what is the temperature of the thermostat?”
”Alexa, increase the thermostat by 1 degree.”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
des:
To use this app you must have a "Rently Smart Home" hub setup. If you want to get a hub, please call 1-855-248-8144 or mail support@rentlykeyless.com . After you get the hub, use your Android or iOS device to download the "Rently Smart Home" App and register with us. 
Once you set up your hub, you can use devices such as Switches, Locks, Thermostats and Dimmers.

Account Linking And Device Discovery steps:

1) Open the Alexa app and go to Link with 'Rently Smart Home' skill and login to your Rently account.
2) If you have invitations to multiple properties you will be able to select a particular property.
3) Say Alexa, discover devices. Your devices will be displayed under Smart Home in the Alexa App.
Note: If you're experiencing issues where devices become unlinked after a certain period, please re-enable the skill. This should resolve the problem, as it has been addressed in the latest update.

Usage Guide

1) To update the names of the devices, use the "Rently Smart Home" app and update the device name to what you would like to call them.
2) Always discover your device to get the changes in device name.
3) Please make sure your hub is online before you try to discover devices using this app.
4) Rently Smart Home app routines can be discovered in Alexa under the scene section.

Operations you can perform using this app:

Thermostat Operations:
 turn on the thermostat
 turn off the thermostat
 set the thermostat to 56 degrees

Lock Operations:
 Lock the "lock_name"
 Note: Unlock not supported due to security concerns.

Dimmable Switch Operations:
 turn on the dimmable switch
 turn off the dimmable switch
 set the dimmable switch to 45 percent

Switch Operations
 turn on the switch
 turn off the switch

Scene operations
 turn on "scene_name"
